episodeTitle: Adventure in the City on the Water! Head to the Mammoth Shipbuilding Plant!
episodeTitleJapanese: 水上都市の冒険！目指せ巨大造船工場
episodeTitleRomanized: Suijō toshi no bōken! Mezase kyodai sōsen kōjō
description: The Straw Hat Pirates explore Water 7's canal system via yagara bulls, witnessing the Galley-La Company's formidable shipwrights defeat the Big Helmet Pirates. While seeking to exchange their gold and repair their ship, Robin mysteriously disappears after a masked figure whispers 'CP9' to her, and the Going Merry comes under attack from the Franky Family.

events.title: Straw Hats Navigate Water 7's Canals
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates explore Water 7 by riding yagara bulls through the city's unique roller coaster-like canal system. They experience the city's unusual transportation network and begin their search for shipwrights.
events.significance: Introduction to Water 7's unique architecture and transportation system, setting the stage for the arc. This marks the crew's first exploration of the shipbuilding capital.

events.title: Big Helmet Pirates Refuse Payment
events.description: Mikazuki, captain of the Big Helmet Pirates with a 36 million berry bounty, refuses to pay the Galley-La Company for repairing his ship, claiming the price is too high. He and his crew attempt to intimidate the shipwrights.
events.significance: Introduces the concept that Water 7's shipwrights are not to be trifled with, foreshadowing the strength of the Galley-La Company members.

quotes.text: We're not paying for this overpriced work!
quotes.speaker: Mikazuki
quotes.context: Refusing to pay the Galley-La Company for ship repairs

events.title: Galley-La Shipwrights Defeat Big Helmet Pirates
events.description: Paulie, Kaku, Peepley Lulu, and Rob Lucci demonstrate their formidable combat abilities by crushing the Big Helmet Pirates using teamwork and a cannon. The shipwrights easily defeat the pirate crew despite their 36 million berry captain.
events.significance: First demonstration of the Galley-La Company's combat prowess. This scene introduces several key characters who will play major roles in the arc, particularly the hidden CP9 agents (Lucci, Kaku, and Kalifa) working undercover as shipwrights.

events.title: Rob Lucci and Hattori Introduction
events.description: The Straw Hats find a crowd praising Rob Lucci, one of the Galley-La Company's top shipwrights. Lucci is seen with his white pigeon Hattori, who wears a red tie and appears to 'speak' through Lucci's ventriloquism.
events.significance: First appearance of Rob Lucci, who will be revealed as the leader of CP9 and Luffy's opponent in one of the series' most iconic battles. His pigeon Hattori allows the cold, emotionless Lucci to blend in with Water 7's citizens by appearing sociable.

events.title: Introduction of Iceburg, Mayor and Galley-La President
events.description: Iceburg is introduced as both the mayor of Water 7 and president of the Galley-La Company. He is shown as a sharply-dressed man with a pet mouse, representing the pride of Water 7's shipbuilding industry.
events.significance: Establishes Iceburg as a central figure in Water 7. His dual role as mayor and president of the city's most prestigious company highlights the importance of shipbuilding to Water 7's identity and economy.

events.title: Paulie, Tilestone, and Peepley Lulu Debut
events.description: Additional Galley-La shipwrights are introduced, including Paulie (a rope specialist), Tilestone (known for his loud voice), and Peepley Lulu. They are shown as skilled workers and fighters who take pride in their craft.
events.significance: Introduces key supporting characters of the Water 7 arc. Paulie in particular will play a significant role as one of Iceburg's most trusted subordinates and later as an ally to the Straw Hats.

events.title: Kalifa's Introduction as Iceburg's Secretary
events.description: Kalifa appears as Iceburg's secretary and advisor, presenting herself as a professional and efficient member of the Galley-La Company's administrative staff.
events.significance: First appearance of Kalifa, who is actually a CP9 agent working undercover. Her position as Iceburg's secretary gives her access to sensitive information about the Ancient Weapon Pluton's blueprints.

events.title: Kaku Introduced as Galley-La Shipwright
events.description: Kaku is introduced as one of the Galley-La Company's expert shipwrights, shown alongside his colleagues during the confrontation with the Big Helmet Pirates.
events.significance: First appearance of Kaku, another CP9 agent undercover as a shipwright. His expertise in carpentry is genuine, and he will later be sent to inspect the Going Merry, leading to heartbreaking news for the Straw Hats.

events.title: Water 7's Unusual Friendliness Toward Pirates
events.description: The Straw Hats notice that Water 7's residents are unusually friendly toward pirates, greeting them warmly rather than with fear or hostility. The locals appear confident and unafraid.
events.significance: Establishes Water 7's unique culture where shipwrights are so powerful that the city has no fear of pirates. This confidence stems from the Galley-La Company's ability to protect the city and defeat any troublemakers.

events.title: Masked Figure Whispers 'CP9' to Robin
events.description: While exploring Water 7 with Chopper near a bookstore, Robin encounters masked carnival participants. A mysterious masked figure approaches her and whispers 'CP9' directly to her, causing her visible shock and alarm.
events.significance: This is the critical moment that sets Robin's arc in motion. The mention of CP9, the World Government's secret assassination unit, triggers Robin's traumatic memories of Ohara's destruction and her lifelong persecution. This encounter causes Robin to believe the government has found her again, leading to her eventual decision to sacrifice herself to protect the Straw Hats.

quotes.speaker: Blueno (masked)
quotes.context: The masked figure's ominous whisper to Robin that triggers her fear and sets the arc's main conflict in motion

events.title: Robin's Mysterious Disappearance
events.description: Chopper enters a bookstore briefly, and when he exits, Robin has completely vanished without a trace. Despite searching the area, Chopper cannot find her anywhere.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Robin's disappearance arc, which will become the emotional core of the Water 7 and Enies Lobby storylines. This moment initiates the chain of events leading to the crew's greatest challenge and the revelation of Robin's tragic past.

events.title: Franky Family Attacks the Going Merry
events.description: Mysterious figures led by Zambai from the Franky Family board the Going Merry while it's docked. They attempt to attack the seemingly sleeping Zoro, who awakens and easily blocks their assault with his sword.
events.significance: First appearance of the Franky Family and their initial conflict with the Straw Hats. This attack is the beginning of the Franky Family storyline, which will eventually lead to Franky himself joining the Straw Hat crew as their shipwright.

quotes.text: We are the Franky Family, and we came to collect the bounty on your head!
quotes.speaker: Zambai
quotes.context: Declaring their intention to capture Zoro for his bounty

events.title: Zoro Defeats Franky Family Members
events.description: Zoro easily counters the Franky Family's attack and defeats them with minimal effort, sending them flying into the water. He demands to know who they are and why they attacked the ship.
events.significance: Demonstrates that the Franky Family, while numerous, are no match for the Straw Hats' combat strength. This encounter establishes the initial antagonistic relationship between the two groups.

events.title: Blueno's Introduction as Bartender
events.description: Blueno makes his first appearance working as a bartender in Water 7, maintaining his cover as an ordinary citizen while secretly operating as a CP9 agent.
events.significance: First appearance of Blueno, a CP9 agent with the Door-Door Fruit ability. He is the one who whispered 'CP9' to Robin while masked. His Devil Fruit power will prove crucial to CP9's operations and the invasion of Enies Lobby.

quotes.speaker: Blueno (masked)
quotes.context: Whispered to Robin, triggering her fear and the arc's central conflict

quotes.text: We are the Franky Family, and we came to collect the bounty on your head!
quotes.speaker: Zambai
quotes.context: Declaring their attack on Zoro and the Going Merry

quotes.text: We're not paying for this overpriced work!
quotes.speaker: Mikazuki
quotes.context: Refusing to pay the Galley-La Company, leading to his defeat

themes.description: The episode introduces numerous characters who are not what they seem. The Galley-La Company's top shipwrights (Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno) are actually government assassins working undercover, while the friendly atmosphere of Water 7 masks the danger lurking beneath.
themes.symbolism: The masked carnival participants represent the hidden identities and secrets that pervade Water 7. The masks literally symbolize how characters are concealing their true selves.

themes.description: Water 7 demonstrates a unique dynamic where shipwrights serve as the city's protectors. The Galley-La Company's strength allows the city to welcome pirates without fear, showing how skilled craftsmanship can translate to combat prowess.
themes.symbolism: The yagara bulls represent Water 7's harmony between nature and civilization, while the canal system shows how the city has adapted to and thrived in its unique environment.
culturalReferences: Venice, Italy - Water 7's canal-based city structure is inspired by Venice's famous waterways and transportation system

themes.description: Robin's encounter with the mention of CP9 represents her past trauma resurfacing. Despite finding a place with the Straw Hats, the ghosts of Ohara and the World Government's persecution still haunt her.
themes.symbolism: Robin's sudden disappearance symbolizes her tendency to flee rather than burden others with her dangerous past, a pattern established since her childhood.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a talented and respected shipwright of the Galley-La Company. Uses his pigeon Hattori as a ventriloquist dummy to appear sociable while maintaining his cold demeanor. Highly praised by Water 7's citizens.
keyActions: Defeats Big Helmet Pirates with fellow shipwrights
Is praised by crowd of citizens
Maintains cover as ordinary shipwright while secretly being CP9's strongest agent

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's traumatic past resurfaces when a masked figure mentions CP9. Her visible shock and subsequent disappearance reveal that despite her time with the Straw Hats, she still carries deep fear of the World Government.
keyActions: Disappears mysteriously, leaving Chopper confused and worried

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his vigilance by remaining alert even while appearing to sleep. He easily handles the Franky Family's attack, showing the vast difference in strength between them and the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Detects and counters Franky Family's attack

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a skilled rope-using shipwright and one of Galley-La's foremen. Shows both craftsmanship and combat ability.
Established as Water 7's mayor and president of Galley-La Company, representing the pinnacle of the city's shipbuilding tradition.
keyActions: Introduced as dual leader of city and company

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes of the Straw Hats riding yagara bulls through Water 7's canals, showing more of the city's layout and architecture than the manga.
The battle between the Galley-La shipwrights and the Big Helmet Pirates is shown with more detail and action sequences in the anime.
Additional shots of Water 7's citizens and their reactions to the Galley-La Company's victory are shown in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final appearance of 'Mirai Kōkai' by Tackey & Tsubasa as the ending theme. It was replaced by 'Eternal Pose' starting with episode 231.
Episode 230 achieved a TV rating of 13.2% in Japan, ranking 4th in its timeslot, demonstrating strong viewership for the beginning of the Water 7 arc.
Rob Lucci's pigeon Hattori always wears a red tie, which is a subtle visual detail that helps distinguish the pigeon and adds to Lucci's eccentric cover persona.
Water 7's design is heavily inspired by Venice, Italy, with its canal-based transportation system and architecture. The yagara bulls serve the same function as gondolas in Venice.

The Big Helmet Pirates' captain Mikazuki has a bounty of 36,000,000 berries, which at this point in the series is actually higher than several of the Straw Hats' individual bounties, yet he and his crew are easily defeated by the Galley-La shipwrights.
This episode adapts portions of three manga chapters (323, 324, and 325), specifically pages 14-19 of chapter 323, pages 9-18 of chapter 324, and pages 6-9 of chapter 325.
Pandaman, Oda's signature hidden character, appears in the background during scenes in Water 7 as part of the masked carnival participants.
